javanews.object
Class COMPortThreadManager

java.lang.Object
  javanews.object.COMPortThreadManager

public class COMPortThreadManager
extends java.lang.Object

Used to contain threads collecting data from one or more COM ports. It maintains two hashtables that should both contain identical keys and the same number of entries. This is used to manage both the data collection thread (instances of PortReader) and the display of that data to and interaction with the user (instances of COMPortClient).

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)
See Also:
PortReader, COMPortClient

Method Detail

getInstance

public static COMPortThreadManager getInstance()
Used to return the instance of the class used by the main application.

After the class has been created and is running in the background through a high-level GUI class (such as Client) then further calls to this class should be made through this method to obtain the original instance rather than creating fresh instances of it.

Returns:
The instance being used within the application

addNewWindow

public void addNewWindow(java.lang.String portName,
                         int baudRate,
                         int dataBits,
                         java.lang.String parityType,
                         float stopBits)
Creates both a new thread for data collection (PortReader) with the supplied parameters and a new data display window (COMPortClient).

Parameters:
portName - The identifying name of the COM port to monitor
baudRate - The COM port's required baud rate
dataBits - The length of the data in bits
parityType - The type of parity to be used for error correction
stopBits - The size of the stop bits

getCOMPortClient

public COMPortClient getCOMPortClient(java.lang.String identifier)
Returns the name instance of COMPortClient from the hashtable.

Parameters:
identifier - The unique name of the required instance
Returns:
The instance of COMPortClient with the provided name
See Also:
COMPortClient

haltThreads

public void haltThreads()
Terminates all executing threads collecting data through the COM port and any associated windows within the GUI. All entries are cleared from the hashtables as well.

getStatusTable

public GenericTable getStatusTable()
Returns an instance of GenericTable containing a list of executing threads and their current status.

Returns:
An instance of GenericTable
See Also:
GenericTable

doesPortExist

public boolean doesPortExist(java.lang.String identifier)
Shows whether or not a port is already configured to run within the hashtables.

Parameters:
identifier - The identifying name of the COM port
Returns:
Whether the COM port is recognised or not

stopThread

public void stopThread(java.lang.String identifier)
Stops the execution of a named thread. It also closes its associated window and removes its entries from the hashtables.

Parameters:
identifier - The identifying name of the COM port
